pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [0db9760f8e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17838/commits/0db9760f8e24f288de090cd01ef3bc467f78a35b)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ instIsScalarTower`
`+ instNonUnitalNormedCommRing`
`+ instNonUnitalSeminormedCommRing`
`+ instSMulCommClass`
`+ instance [IsScalarTower ùïú Œ≤ Œ≤] : IsScalarTower ùïú (Œ± ‚Üí·µá Œ≤) (Œ± ‚Üí·µá Œ≤)`
`+ instance [SMul R M] [ContinuousConstSMul R M] [Mul M] [ContinuousMul M] [IsScalarTower R M M] :`
`+ instance [SMul R M] [ContinuousConstSMul R M] [Mul M] [ContinuousMul M] [SMulCommClass M R M] :`
`+ instance [SMul R M] [ContinuousConstSMul R M] [Mul M] [ContinuousMul M] [SMulCommClass R M M] :`
`+ instance [SMulCommClass ùïú Œ≤ Œ≤] : SMulCommClass (Œ± ‚Üí·µá Œ≤) ùïú (Œ± ‚Üí·µá Œ≤)`
`+ instance [SMulCommClass ùïú Œ≤ Œ≤] : SMulCommClass ùïú (Œ± ‚Üí·µá Œ≤) (Œ± ‚Üí·µá Œ≤)`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

@eric-wieser this is per [this comment](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16645#discussion_r1755676910) of yours, but I didn't really follow the "symmetric version" portion of that comment. What did you mean exactly?

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11443267492/job/31835517687)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11443267492/job/31835518061)

bors merge

Thanks! The `SMul` diamond questions are interesting but definitely out of scope for this PR.

bors merge

Thanks! The `SMul` diamond questions are interesting but definitely out of scope for this PR.
The symmetric version here is `SMulCommClass C(Œ±, M) R C(Œ±, M)` given `SMulCommClass M R M`
This one should have the symmetric version too.

I think that [ContinuousMap.instSMul'](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/ContinuousMap/Algebra.html#ContinuousMap.instSMul%27) should be generalized to `[SMul R M] [ContinuousSMul R M]` and these instances should be generalized to `IsScalarTower R C(Œ±, S) C(Œ±, M)` etc.
@eric-wieser Does `instSMul'` generate diamonds for something like `SMul C(Œ±, M) C(Œ±, C(Œ±, M))`?

Yes, that instance definitely generates diamonds, and should probably be scoped/deinstanced as a result.

All `SMul R A` -> `SMul (F R) (F A)` instances are bad in this sense, at least whenever `A = F R` is possible.

In that case I would prefer that:

1. the generalization / scoping of `instSMul'` is left for a future PR.
2. these instances are left here as is (since they apply to an instance which is/will be available globally).

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add missing instances for `ContinuousMap` and `BoundedContinuousFunction`
